intro: Trichera collina var. subscaposa, commonly known as the slender trichera, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It is characterized by its narrow, ascending stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces white to pale purple flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for coastal gardens. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
